children.subject: For many students, just the 170 and 162 combination is too much on its own. I am taking a similar schedule as you right now, except I have 61C and 170 instead of 162 and 170; and I'm finding that these two classes compete with each other for time and that I should have taken them separately. I hear 162 has an even higher workload and is more difficult than 61C, so I would really consider switching one of those for a lighter CS course. 170 doesn't take as much time per se, but it is a very conceptually challenging class and that might merit more time spent on the problem sets (which are pretty long and difficult) or time spent just rewatching lectures and reading notes. Adding the potentially heaviest project base CS course will make learning the 170 material difficult, I'd say.

I have taken CS162, CS170, and MCB150 and would say that the load is doable especially given that the coursework types complement each other (162 is project based, 170 is weekly psets, and 150 is irregular psets + lots of exam studying). However, it will definitely be a hard semester since all three classes require plenty of time to digest.

history.content:
Can anyone offer some opinions on the difficulty of the following courseload for next semester?

CS 170, CS 162, MCB 150, Socio 3AC

I expect Socio 3AC to be an easy A class, and MCB 150 will probably take about 6 hours a week.

Thanks in advance.
history.subject: Course Load
